data.title: Jamaica Inn (1939)
meta_keywords: Jamaica Inn (1936) by Daphne du Maurier
Jamaica Inn (1939) - complete cast and crew
data.text:
Synopsis

Irish orphan girl Mary is sent to stay with Aunt Patience and Uncle Joss in Cornwall. Joss is the landlord of Jamaica Inn and also the head of a gang of pirates who lure ships to their doom on the rocky coast. Mary soon finds herself in trouble when she discovers the truth. (© IMDB)

Production

Coming soon...

Screenplay

Casting

Principal Photography

Release & Reception

Preservation Status

At some point, American film collector Raymond Rohauer took a print of the film and inserted replacement title credits. It's uncertain if Rohauer made any further alterations to the film, but this is often print used on official DVD releases of the film. Many of the America bootleg DVD releases of the film are missing around 8 minutes of footage which seriously impacts on the film's continuity.

In January 2013, the Cohen Media Group acquired the Rohauer Library of films and subsequently partnered with the British Film Institute to undertake a full 4K digital restoration of the film, based on the BFI's original nitrate negatives of the film.[1] The new print was premiered at the 2014 Cannes Film Festival on 22 May 2014.[2]
